meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Equatorial Guinea.
meanings.sent1: In Equatorial Guinea, you can buy many things with just one ekpwele.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for ekpwele at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The ekpwele in my pocket jingled as I walked, making me feel rich.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny ekpwele, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The ekpwele was so valuable, everyone wanted to have it.

meanings.definition: A type of traditional dance in Equatorial Guinea.
meanings.sent1: The ekpwele at the festival was full of energy and rhythm.
meanings.sent2: People gathered around to watch the colorful ekpwele performance.
meanings.sent3: I tried to do the ekpwele dance, but ended up tripping over my own feet.
meanings.sent4: The ekpwele dancers moved as gracefully as swaying trees in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the drums accompanied the lively ekpwele beautifully.

meanings.definition: A type of plant found in Equatorial Guinea.
meanings.sent1: The ekpwele plant had vibrant green leaves and delicate flowers.
meanings.sent2: I admired the beauty of the ekpwele growing in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel nibbled on the leaves of the ekpwele plant.
meanings.sent4: The ekpwele plant stood tall like a guardian in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the ekpwele filled the air with a sweet scent.
